title: Mac Os El Capitan 1.11 (League not working)
body: League wanted me to update so i pressed restart now so i can update my game. But, there was nothing after that and i tried to reinstall and when i pressed launch, nothing will happen, i checked activity monitor and nothing happened. My friend upgraded to Os Sierra and it worked for him. But my operating system doesn't work. Any fixes that i can do? I even tried to reinstall El Capitan and nothing happened

replies.body:
We're working on ironing out these Mac issues as best we can, and it seems like this issue is isolated to older Mac around 2007. I've noticed several players have been able to get things up and running again by updating their Mac OS as close to Sierra as possible, but for some players that simply isn't an option. 

I'd like you to go ahead and hit up our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so that they can work with you one on one to get this figured out, as well as gather more data about this issue!

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=t8xunguj,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-05-23T02:49:39.643+0000)
>
> We're working on ironing out these Mac issues as best we can, and it seems like this issue is isolated to older Mac around 2007. I've noticed several players have been able to get things up and running again by updating their Mac OS as close to Sierra as possible, but for some players that simply isn't an option. 
> 
> I'd like you to go ahead and hit up our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so that they can work with you one on one to get this figured out, as well as gather more data about this issue!

I have OS Sierra on my MAC but I'm having the same issues. I started patching for 7.10 and it stopped installing. League wouldn't open anymore, I reinstalled and when I hit launch, the client disappears and the new client doesn't appear.
Thank you so much, my mac is an older version around mid 2007 although this being the case that friend i mentioned also had a late 2007 model or 2009 he wasn't sure and got Os Sierra.

Go ahead and follow Broporo's help. He's the rioter of this forum and he's better at this than I am. 

The logs you would attach to the support ticket.

Hello Hokage,

I don't know much about iOS (Mac) with league but I can try to help. What I want you to do is find your r3d logs by doing the steps outlined here: 

> [{quoted}](name=dArtagnan,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Pvz5Ebbc,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-01-30T22:41:11.641+0000)
>
>
> 
> There are two different ways you can actually get to this location while on a Mac:
> 
> **With Mouse**:  Right click the LoL application icon in the application folder and select "show package contents"
> 
> **Without Mouse/Just trackpad**:  Command-click the LoL application icon in the application folder
> 
> Hope this helps!  Remember, there will not be any files there unless games have been played.

I would like you to then open up a support ticket and explains the situation - while attaching those logs. I hope this helps!
after finding the r3d log what do i do? Thanks for the advice ill try it but i don't know what to do after the r3d file
